active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs of relying on fire blankets versus automated suppression systems in high-value cybersecurity environments like server rooms. Consider factors such as response time, false alarms, and cyber-physical threat integration (e.g., arson enabled by insider threats). Support arguments with NIST PE-13 and real-world case studies.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in (ISC)² domains. Topic: Fire Blanket Distribution (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Physical and Facility Security Design > Environmental Controls and Life Safety > Fire Suppression Systems > Fire Blanket Distribution). Use this research context: Fire blankets smother small fires (Class E/K), key for physical security in data centers/server rooms. NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: PE-13 (Fire Protection: position suppressors per requirements), PE-1 (Policy), CP-2 (Contingency Plan: include physical recovery). Placement: near electrical panels/servers (1.5-2m height, 1 per 50m²/ignition source), signage, training (drills), maintenance (inspections). Integrate with resilience against cyber-physical threats. Sources: NIST SP 800-53 [https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/53/r5/upd1/final], NFPA 10, OSHA fire safety guidelines. Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [insert full list from above] - Scaffolding Layers: [insert full layers from above] - Active Learning: Tie cards to activities (e.g., 'Apply for problem-solving exercise') - Bloom's progression: Balance lower (recall) to higher (create) levels. Generate 50-75 flashcards following this exact schema: JSON array of objects with {front: string, back: {answer: string, explanation: string (link to objective/layer/NIST), hints: array[1-2], references: string}, type: 'remember|understand|apply|analyze|evaluate|create', layer: 1|2|3|4}. Use 40% MCQs with 4 options (front lists A-D, answer specifies correct letter + full text; distractors per protocol: plausible errors like misplacing near exits or confusing controls). Ensure web-grounded accuracy, voter priorities (completeness on guidelines/training), and high-quality for spaced repetition (Anki-compatible). Vary formats: cloze, Q&A, scenarios. Output ONLY the JSON array.
